bunpro.meaning: Even if, No matter what, Whether or not, [Emphatic], Volitional+が
bunpro.writeup: When both the positive and negative volitionalauxiliary verbsare combined with a verb in Japanese, it has the nuance of 'whether or not (A)', the result will be (B)'. This is quite emphatic, and has a literal meaning similar to 'say it does (A) or say it doesn't (A), it will still be (B)'.As a reminder, the positiveauxiliary verbsof volition are either う or よう, depending on what they are being connected to, while the negativeauxiliary verbof volition is まい. Either thecase marking particleが or と will appear after both the positive and the negative, with が being slightly more common.While this structure is primarily seen after verbs, it is important to remember that otherauxiliary verbssuch as だ can be conjugated in the same way, as can い-Adjectives with the less common かろう structure. This means that both nouns, な-Adjectives and い-Adjectives can also appear using a similar grammar pattern. However, because the negative volitional まい cannot pair with these structures, an antonym will usually appear with them instead, with both words using the う or よう positive volitional.Based primarily on the use of volitionals, this grammar pattern will often indicate the speaker's strong will or opinion that will not change regardless of (A).

examples.japanese: 忘年会に出席しようが出席するまいが、会費はみんなからもらっています。
examples.english: Whether you attend the year-end party or not, we will collect the admissions fee from everyone.

examples.japanese: 雨が降ろうが降るまいが、明日は絶対に釣りに行くと決めた。
examples.english: Whether it rains or not, I have decided to go fishing tomorrow.

examples.japanese: 楽しかろうが楽しくなかろうが、学校は子供の仕事だから学校には行かなくてはだめだ。
examples.english: Whether it is fun or not, school is a child's job, so you must go to school.

examples.japanese: 安全だろうが安全でなかろうが、２メートル以上の場所に上がる場合は安全帯を必ず装着してください。
examples.english: Whether it is safe or not, always wear a safety belt when you climb to a place higher than 2 meters.

examples.japanese: 犬であろうが猫であろうが、どちらにしても動物なので軽い気持ちで買っては行けない。
examples.english: Whether it is a dog or a cat, they are both animals, so they must not be bought on a whim.

examples.japanese: 人が何と言おうが、ずっとあなたを愛しています！
examples.english: No matter what people say, I will always love you!

examples.japanese: 生徒が授業に出席しようが出席するまいが、私はきちんと授業を進めていく。
examples.english: Whether or not students attend, I will proceed with my lecture as planned.

examples.japanese: 何年がかかろうと、ドラゴンボールを見つけるつもりだ！
examples.english: Even if it takes many years, I intend to find the dragon balls!

examples.japanese: 商品は上質であろうが悪質であろうが、よく売れるものはよく売れる。
examples.english: Whether the product is of good quality or low quality, if it sells well, it sells well.

examples.japanese: 日本語の勉強が難しかろうが易しかろうが、流暢に話せるようになるまで勉強する。
examples.english: Whether learning Japanese is difficult or easy, I will learn until I become fluent.

false_friends.meaning: Even if I have to, By any or all means, No matter what
Even if, Even though, No matter how
